title: b'[BUG] CVE-2021-44228 Vulnerability'
comments:
[b'The issue is closed. Does it mean that MLFlow does not have CVE-2021-44228 vulnerability? ', b'@tomsej I closed it initially because I didnt have a lot of evidence on what was going on. But we have found that it does potentially affect you if you are using `mleap` flavor when model serving.', b'any update on this critical issue? 5 days are past.. ', b"@tallen94 @tomsej @agsha An audit of the MLflow Java Client and MLflow Java Scoring Server packages does not indicate the presence of `log4j`. The ticket filer, @tallen94, correctly indicates that `slf4j` is a dependency of these packages. However, `slf4j` is *not* a wrapper around `log4j`. Rather, it is a standardized interface for event logging in Java that is compatible with a variety of Java logging libraries, including log4j and many others. Simply including `slf4j` as a dependency does not automatically include `log4j`. In fact, these MLflow Java packages incorporate a different slf4j-compatible logging package as a dependency: Apache Commons Logging (https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-logging/). For reference, see the dependency trees for the MLflow Java Client and MLflow Java Scoring Server:

An audit of the MLflow Spark Autologging Java Package indicates that the package has a transitive dependency on an unaffected version of log4j that does not suffer from https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-44228:

```
~/mlflow/mlflow/java/spark ((HEAD detached at v1.21.0)) $ mvn dependency:tree | grep log4j
[INFO] |  +- log4j:log4j:jar:1.2.17:compile
[INFO] |  +- org.slf4j:slf4j-log4j12:jar:1.7.16:compile
```



Finally, an audit of all previous MLflow Java package versions also confirms that: 1. the MLflow Client and MLflow Scoring Java packages do not depend on `log4j`, and 2. the MLflow Spark Autologging Java package does not depend on an affected version of `log4j`.

Given that MLflow's Java Packages do not appear to be impacted by this issue, I'm going to go ahead and close this ticket. Please reopen it if there are any additional questions or concerns.

___

Note: MLflow's Java Client package *does* include a `log4j.properties` file (https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/java/client/src/main/resources/log4j.properties), which configures the behavior of `log4j` *if* it is installed on a user's system. The MLflow Java Client package does not directly include `log4j`, and this properties file has no impact unless a user installs `log4j` separately."]
